File libsrc/libgobject/Segment.c

This class represents a segment of a time series. The segment has a uniform time increment (sample rate) and no data gaps. 
  typedef struct
  {
 	GObjectPart	core;
 
 	double          tbeg;           * time of the first data sample *
 	double          tdel;           * time increment *
 	float           *data;          * data samples *
 	int		data_length;    * number of samples in this segment *
 	double          calib;          * calibration factor *
 	double          calper;         * calibration period *
  } *Segment;

See Also:

Public Function Index

new_Segment (float *, int, double, double, double, double)
Constructs a Segment from a float[] array.

Constructs a Segment from a double[] array.

Constructs a Segment with data initialized to 0.

Creates a new Segment that is a subsegment of this Segment.

Replace the data of this segment with the input array.

Set the calibration factor and the calibration period.
Segment_tbeg (Segment)
Returns the beginning time of this Segment.
Segment_tdel (Segment)
Returns the time increment of this Segment.
Segment_tend (Segment)
Returns the end time of this Segment.

Public Functions

new_Segment 
 Segment new_Segment(float *data,
                     int data_length,
                     double tbeg,
                     double tdel,
                     double calib,
                     double calper)
Constructs a Segment from a float[] array. The Segment length will be data.length.

Parameters:
data - float Segment data.
tbeg - The beginning time of the Segment.
tdel - The time increment between Segment data.
calib - The calibration factor.
calper - The calibration period.
new_Segment_d 
 Segment new_Segment_d(double *data,
                       int data_length,
                       double tbeg,
                       double tdel,
                       double calib,
                       double calper)
Constructs a Segment from a double[] array. The Segment length will be data.length. The data are converted to float.

Parameters:
data - double Segment data.
tbeg - The beginning time of the Segment.
tdel - The time increment between Segment data.
calib - The calibration factor.
calper - The calibration period.
new_Segment_n 
 Segment new_Segment_n(int initialLength,
                       double tbeg,
                       double tdel,
                       double calib,
                       double calper)
Constructs a Segment with data initialized to 0.

Parameters:
initialLength - The initial length of the Segment. Must be >= 0.
tbeg - The beginning time of the Segment.
tdel - The time increment between Segment data. Must be > 0.
calib - The calibration factor.
calper - The calibration period.
Segment_subsegment 
 Segment Segment_subsegment(Segment s,
                            int beginIndex,
                            int endIndex)
Creates a new Segment that is a subsegment of this Segment. The subsegment begins at the specified beginIndex and extends to the data at index endIndex-1. Must be >= 0 && < s->data_length && >= beginIndex.

Parameters:
beginIndex - the beginning index, inclusive. Must be >= 0 && < s->data_length.
endIndex - the ending index, exclusive.
Segment_setData 
 void Segment_setData(Segment s,
                      float *data)
Replace the data of this segment with the input array. The length of data[] must be <= s->data_length.
Segment_setCalibration 
 void Segment_setCalibration(Segment s,
                             double calib,
                             double calper)
Set the calibration factor and the calibration period.
Segment_tbeg 
 double Segment_tbeg(Segment s)
Returns the beginning time of this Segment.
Segment_tdel 
 double Segment_tdel(Segment s)
Returns the time increment of this Segment.
Segment_tend 
 double Segment_tend(Segment s)
Returns the end time of this Segment.
